meanings.definition: To divide into separate, interconnected modules.
meanings.sent1: I will modularize the project into smaller parts for easier management.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to modularize their software development process.
meanings.sent3: Trying to modularize my closet ended up in a big mess of mixed-up clothes!
meanings.sent4: She managed to modularize her thoughts, organizing them like neatly stacked blocks.
meanings.sent5: The concept of modularizing the curriculum made the learning process more efficient.

meanings.definition: To design or construct in a modular form.
meanings.sent1: The architect will modularize the building to allow for future expansions.
meanings.sent2: It is important to modularize the furniture for easy assembly and disassembly.
meanings.sent3: He tried to modularize his sandwich, but it just fell apart in layers!
meanings.sent4: The artist modularized the painting, creating sections that fit together perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The idea to modularize the garden layout brought a sense of order to the design.
